web3.title: Royal
web3.description: A smart contract and CLI built on Cardano using Haskell and Python, enabling users to define ownership percentages for multiple participants.

web3.title: Comp
web3.description: A smart contract, written in Aiken for the Cardano blockchain allowing users to join competitions and be voted on by paying a fee.

web3.title: Blistering
web3.description: A Web3 site with Cardano payment integration which facilitates the purchase of advertisement space on various websites.

web3.title: Nano Point Of Sale
web3.description: A desktop Point of Sale (POS) application designed to process payments using the Nano cryptocurrency (XNO).

web3.title: Voteaire
web3.description: A Web3 site where users can create ballots and vote via the blockchain integrated with an oracle and an escrow smart-contract.

web3.title: Goofs
web3.description: A Web3 site that allows users to mint and customize NFTs. Users can purchase clothing and items for their NFTs and equip them directly on the website.

web3.title: Degen Dice
web3.description: A Web3 site where users can place bets on the outcome of a dice roll, featuring payment integration and a blockchain algorithm for generating secure random numbers.

web3.title: Veggies Staking
web3.description: A Web3 platform that allows users to stake tokens and earn rewards based on the duration of their staking.

web3.title: Dramz Auction House
web3.description: A Web3 auction site for NFTs, where users can list their NFTs for auction and other users can place bids on them.

web3.title: Franchise Pass
web3.description: A Web3 site where users can upgrade their purchased NFTs with custom names, background animations, and theme songs.

web3.title: League of Ninja Warriors
web3.description: A Web3 site to showcase and purchase the League of Ninja Warriors NFTs.

ai.title: Telegram Tracker
ai.description: A python script to keep track of prices at an online marketplace and warn the user when a price discount happened.

ai.title: PyProxy
ai.description: A Python script designed to filter and identify functional proxies from a provided list of IP addresses. The script tests each proxy by attempting a connection, and any proxies that successfully work are saved to an output file for further use.

ai.title: Sky Scraper
ai.description: A script built using Python for web-scraping and parsing christian hymns.

ai.title: AI Detect
ai.description: This project applies over five machine learning techniques to determine whether a text was written by a student or a large language model (LLM). The performance of each technique is compared, with Random Forest showing the best results, followed by K-Nearest Neighbors (K-NN).

ai.title: PromptQ
ai.description: This project involves a highly efficient REST API written in Go, designed to bridge AI prompts with AI servers. It enables a computer to run AI models locally and respond to user prompts, all while keeping the AI network secure and not publicly accessible.

software.title: Slides Generator
software.description: This is a collection of Python modules designed to scrape music lyrics from the web and convert them into slide presentations. The tools automate the process of gathering lyrics and formatting them into slides, making it easier to create presentations for events like karaoke, sing-alongs, or performances.

software.title: Palestrinha
software.description: Palestrinha is a website developed for students to share and search for college events and parties. Events are categorized based on areas defined by the organizers, allowing users to filter listings according to their interests and preferences.

software.title: BBA
software.description: As part of a college project, we implemented the Netflix Buffer-Based Adaptation (BBA) algorithm for video streaming. We began by forking PyDash, an educational tool developed by our professor for simulating video streaming. Following the guidelines from the corresponding scientific paper, we implemented the BBA algorithm in its three variations: BBA-0, BBA-1, and BBA-2.

software.title: Img2RiscV
software.description: A very efficient tool built using Rust that converts images to a .data format accepted by the Assembly RISC-V CPUs.

software.title: The One
software.description: This project is an implementation of the "The One" programming style in Scala, based on Crista Lopez's book Exercises in Programming Styles. While the book presents the style in Python, this project adapts and implements it in Scala.

software.title: Ctrl Sim
software.description: This project implements robotic movement for TurtleBot using ROS2 and Gazebo. Written in Python, it features a PI controller that enables the robot to move toward a target while detecting and avoiding obstacles.

software.title: FLang
software.description: This project is a complete implementation of a functional language in Scala, including both a parser and an interpreter. It leverages functional programming techniques such as Monads, Monad Transformers, and Parser Combinators.

software.title: Oberon-Scala
software.description: Oberon-Scala is a project developed by my professor to implement the Oberon language in Scala. I contributed by fully refactoring the Type Checker, transforming it from object-oriented code to a fully functional design using Monad Transformers.

software.title: Varese Crowdfunding
software.description: In collaboration with an Italian colleague, we partnered with the Varese School to host a crowdfunding competition. We created a website for students to submit project ideas, which other students could fund with virtual credits. Upon evaluation by a teacher, students would receive credits if they completed their projects.

software.title: Varese School Cup
software.description: Following the successful implementation of the crowdfunding initiative with the Varese School, we partnered with additional Italian schools to expand the project. This time, we developed a new website that allowed schools to create their own organizations. Within these organizations, students could form and join groups, with each group submitting projects for evaluation by teachers.
